about_the_game:
SIGNAL LOST is a short cosmic-horror exploration and management game that draws heavy inspiration from the fear of the unknown.

FEATURES

  • Experimental spacecraft gameplay, where you must keep your ship operational by completing a variety of tasks through a command-driven interface
  • Keep your spacecraft functional by repairing malfunctioning systems
  • Immerse yourself in the cockpit
  • Cosmic horror and psychological horror elements as you face a new frontier
  • Suiting sounds and atmosphere
  • A short experience lasting around an hour

GAMEPLAY

Set in a tightly cramped, quickly thrown together spacecraft, you must travel through space to reach Venus, repairing malfunctions and completing tasks as you go on your journey.

You must use the instruments in the ship to capture photographs, readings and send messages, repair malfunctioning systems and avoid dangers. Each instrument is unique, so make sure to pay attention to the information it's providing you with! But that is not enough, since your systems are prone to malfunctions, you will need to maintain them by physically interacting with them.

You will be required to multitask, be patient and efficient. But above all you must be brave, you're all alone.

STORY


Castle Industries, the world's largest arms, technology, nuclear and electronics research company, and aide to many, many governments, has tasked you with finding the distress signal that has been calling from Venus. The greatest minds of the world designed the necessary equipment for you to do so, with a spaceship equipped with top-of-the-line technology in photography, communications, measurements and much more... Nothing can go wrong for this mission!

There are rumours of strange findings in the Venusian caves, and you've been selected to be the lucky person to re-investigate these claims. As the last mission did not have the.. ehrm, desirable results, this new mission will try to collect information about the previous mission and transmit the findings back to Earth, while tracking the distress signal from the last mission. The scientists in Hazoria have been able to connect with Venus, but with unstable and unsatisfactory results. The re-exploration of the planet will surely lead to advancements in the mapping of this area!

As you go through space, you will encounter various.. problems. It's up to you to keep your vessel operational, but don't worry! You have been properly trained for this, as you obviously remember! And besides that, the equipment aboard the ship is top notch.

So, keep the ship running as best as you can in order to reach Venus. Remember, keep going no matter what you see or hear. But don't worry, in any case your distress signal will start transmitting and someone will be on the rescue soon.
